title: Medical Communication and Professional Language Course for Training POCUS Practitioners in Low-Income Settings

context.prior_knowledge: Basic medical knowledge, experience in interpreting medical imaging, and proficiency in basic medical terminology and clinical report writing. Foundational understanding of medical communication and use of specialized terminology.
context.additional_context: Practical training for medical service managers/leaders in enterprises, focusing on acquiring field-applicable POCUS skills alongside professional medical terminology, effective report writing, and clear communication. Aims to simultaneously strengthen clinical judgment and linguistic precision

learning_goals: Achieve accurate medical terminology-based evaluations and evidence-based conclusions for five emergency clinical scenarios (trauma, obstetrics, infections, etc.) using POCUS equipment in low-resource settings.
Cultivate the ability to achieve over 80% diagnostic accuracy by applying POCUS protocols under resource constraints, write structured reports, and utilize specialized medical terminology.

Within one week, learners can draft an implementation plan for introducing a POCUS education system (mandatory inclusion of three out of four elements: goal setting, budget allocation, scheduling, risk management), deliver a five-minute presentation meeting at least four out of five rubric criteria (clarity, logic, professionalism, time management, visual aids), and communicate using over ten specialized medical terms and clear expressions.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
